examples: He was affirmed as a candidate.

definition: to assert (something, such as a judgment or decree) as valid or confirmed
to show or express a strong belief in or dedication to (something, such as an important idea)
examples: laws affirming the racial equality of all people

definition: to testify or declare by affirmation (see affirmation sense 2) as distinguished from swearing an oath
to uphold a judgment or decree of a lower court
